# Card

import { DarkModeCompatible } from '../../../src/components/DarkModeCompatible';

<DarkModeCompatible />

Flexible container for grouping related content and actions. Use cards to organize information into digestible, focused sections with optional headers, footers, and visual variants.

## Overview

Use `Card` when you need…

- A clear surface to group related content and actions
- An optional header via `title` / `subtitle`
- An optional footer via `footer` (actions, meta, etc.)
- Visual styling via `variant` and spacing via `padding`
- An interactive affordance via `hoverable` + `onClick`

## Live Demo

<LiveDemo />

## Import

```tsx
import { Card } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';
```

## Basic Usage

```tsx
<Card title="Title" subtitle="Optional subtitle">
  Content goes here.
</Card>
```

## Anatomy

The Card component consists of several key parts:

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  Title                                  │  ← Header (optional)
│  Subtitle or description                │
├─────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                         │
│  Main content area for text, images,    │  ← Body (children)
│  or other components                    │
│                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  Footer content or actions              │  ← Footer (optional)
└─────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

**Component Structure:**
- **Container**: Outer wrapper with border radius, shadow/border, and background
- **Header** (optional): Title and subtitle section at the top
- **Title** (optional): Primary heading text (h3) for the card
- **Subtitle** (optional): Secondary descriptive text below title
- **Body**: Main content area containing `children` prop
- **Footer** (optional): Bottom section for actions, metadata, or supplementary info
- **Image Area**: Can be placed in body or used with `padding="none"` for full-bleed images

**Visual States:**
- **Default**: Normal non-interactive card with border or shadow based on variant
- **Hover** (hoverable): Elevated shadow and subtle lift transform on mouse over
- **Focus** (clickable): Focus indicator when card has onClick handler
- **Clickable**: Pointer cursor indicating the entire card is interactive

## API Reference

### Props

| Prop        | Type                                                | Default     | Description                          |
| ----------- | --------------------------------------------------- | ----------- | ------------------------------------ |
| `children`  | `ReactNode`                                         | Required    | Card content                         |
| `title`     | `string`                                            | -           | Card title (header)                  |
| `subtitle`  | `string`                                            | -           | Card subtitle/description (header)   |
| `footer`    | `ReactNode`                                         | -           | Footer slot (actions, meta, etc.)    |
| `variant`   | `'default' \| 'elevated' \| 'outlined' \| 'filled'` | `'default'` | Visual variant                       |
| `padding`   | `'none' \| 'small' \| 'medium' \| 'large'`          | `'medium'`  | Padding size                         |
| `hoverable` | `boolean`                                           | `false`     | Add hover affordance                 |
| `onClick`   | `() => void`                                        | -           | Click handler (makes card clickable) |
| `className` | `string`                                            | -           | Additional CSS classes               |

Also supports all standard HTML `div` attributes for the container element.

### Variant Details

- **default**: Standard card with subtle border (most common, clean appearance)
- **elevated**: Card with medium shadow and no border (adds depth, good for overlays)
- **outlined**: Card with thicker 2px border (strong definition, good for emphasis)
- **filled**: Card with secondary background color (subtle differentiation from page)

### Padding Details

- **none**: No padding (0px) - use for full-bleed images or custom layouts
- **small**: Compact padding (16px) - dense interfaces or small cards
- **medium**: Default padding (24px) - balanced spacing for most use cases
- **large**: Generous padding (32px) - spacious layouts or prominent cards

### Interactive Props Details

**hoverable**: When `true`, adds hover effects (shadow elevation and transform lift) without making the card clickable. Use for visual affordance when card contains interactive elements inside.

**onClick**: Function called when card is clicked. Automatically adds pointer cursor. For accessibility, prefer placing explicit buttons/links inside the card rather than making the entire card clickable.

## Best Practices

### Do ✅

- Use `title` / `subtitle` to provide structure for dense content
- Use `footer` for actions or meta information, not for primary content
- Use `hoverable` only when the card is actually interactive or needs an affordance
- Place explicit buttons or links inside the card for primary actions
- Keep card content focused on a single topic or action
- Use consistent variants across similar card types in the same interface

### Don't ❌

- Don't overload cards with too many actions; prefer a clear primary action
- Don't rely on `onClick` alone to convey navigation; include an explicit link/button when possible
- Don't nest cards inside cards (causes visual hierarchy confusion)
- Don't use cards for single lines of text (use simpler container components)
- Don't mix too many variants on the same page (creates visual noise)

## Accessibility

The Card component is designed with WCAG 2.1 AA compliance in mind:

### Keyboard Navigation

By default, `Card` renders a non-interactive `div` with no keyboard navigation.

**For Interactive Cards:**
- When using `onClick`, the card itself is **not** keyboard accessible by default
- **Best practice**: Place an explicit `<button>` or `<a>` element inside the card for keyboard users
- If the entire card must be clickable, wrap it in a button or add proper keyboard handlers

```tsx
// ✅ Good - Accessible clickable card
<Card title="Product" hoverable>
  <p>Product description</p>
  <button onClick={handleClick}>View Details</button>
</Card>

// ❌ Avoid - Card onClick without keyboard access
<Card title="Product" onClick={handleClick} hoverable>
  <p>Product description</p>
</Card>
```

### Screen Reader Support

**For Standard Cards:**
```tsx
<Card title="User Profile" subtitle="Account details">
  <p>Name: John Doe</p>
  <p>Email: john@example.com</p>
</Card>
// Title announces as heading (h3)
// Content reads normally
```

**For Cards with Semantic Headings:**
```tsx
<Card>
  <h2>Custom Heading</h2>
  <p>Content here</p>
</Card>
// Use when you need specific heading levels (h1, h2, h4, etc.)
// Omit title prop and use semantic HTML inside children
```

**For Clickable Cards:**
```tsx
<Card title="Article" hoverable>
  <p>Article preview...</p>
  <a href="/article/123">Read more</a>
</Card>
// Screen reader announces heading, content, and "Read more, link"
// Link is keyboard accessible with Tab key
```

### Best Practices for Accessibility

#### Do ✅

- Use semantic heading levels (`title` renders h3, or use custom headings in `children`)
- Ensure sufficient color contrast for text on card backgrounds
- Place interactive elements (buttons/links) inside the card, not on card itself
- Keep card content concise and scannable
- Use descriptive titles that make sense out of context
- Provide meaningful link/button text ("Read more" is vague, "Read article about X" is better)

#### Don't ❌

- Don't make entire card clickable without visible interactive elements inside
- Don't use cards purely for decoration (should contain meaningful content)
- Don't rely on color alone to convey information (use text/icons too)
- Don't remove focus indicators from interactive elements inside cards
- Don't use vague calls to action like "Click here" or "Learn more" without context

### ARIA Attributes

The Card component is a presentational container and does not apply ARIA roles by default. You can add ARIA attributes for specific use cases:

```tsx
// For landmark card sections
<Card
  title="Latest News"
  aria-label="Latest news articles"
  role="region"
>
  <ArticleList />
</Card>

// For clickable cards (prefer button inside instead)
<Card
  onClick={handleClick}
  role="button"
  tabIndex={0}
  onKeyDown={(e) => {
    if (e.key === 'Enter' || e.key === ' ') {
      handleClick();
    }
  }}
  aria-label="Navigate to product details"
>
  <ProductInfo />
</Card>
```

**Automatically Handled:**
- Card header uses semantic `h3` for title
- Footer has top border for visual separation
- Hover and clickable states use CSS transforms and cursor changes

**You Can Add:**
- `role="region"` and `aria-label` for landmark sections
- `role="button"`, `tabIndex`, and keyboard handlers for fully clickable cards
- `aria-describedby` to link card content to external descriptions

### Color Contrast

All card variants meet WCAG 2.1 AA contrast requirements:

- **Title text**: Uses `text-text-primary` token (minimum 4.5:1 contrast)
- **Subtitle text**: Uses `text-text-secondary` token (minimum 4.5:1 contrast)
- **Body text**: Uses `text-text-secondary` token (minimum 4.5:1 contrast)
- **Borders**: Uses design system border tokens (minimum 3:1 contrast)
- **Filled variant**: Secondary background maintains sufficient contrast for all text

Tested in both light and dark modes across all variants.

## Common Patterns

### Product Card

```tsx title="src/components/ProductCard.tsx"
import { Card } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function ProductCard({ product }) {
  return (
    <Card
      variant="elevated"
      padding="none"
      hoverable
    >
      <img
        src={product.image}
        alt={product.name}
        style={{ width: '100%', height: '200px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
      />
      <div style={{ padding: '16px' }}>
        <h3>{product.name}</h3>
        <p>{product.description}</p>
        <p style={{ fontSize: '20px', fontWeight: 'bold' }}>
          ${product.price}
        </p>
        <button onClick={() => addToCart(product)}>
          Add to Cart
        </button>
      </div>
    </Card>
  );
}
```

### User Profile Card

```tsx title="src/components/UserProfileCard.tsx"
import { Card } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function UserProfileCard({ user }) {
  return (
    <Card
      title={user.name}
      subtitle={user.role}
      footer={
        <div style={{ display: 'flex', gap: '8px' }}>
          <button>Message</button>
          <button>Follow</button>
        </div>
      }
    >
      <div style={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: '16px' }}>
        <img
          src={user.avatar}
          alt=""
          style={{ width: '64px', height: '64px', borderRadius: '50%' }}
        />
        <div>
          <p>Email: {user.email}</p>
          <p>Joined: {user.joinDate}</p>
        </div>
      </div>
    </Card>
  );
}
```

### Dashboard Widget

```tsx title="src/components/DashboardWidget.tsx"
import { Card } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function DashboardWidget({ title, value, trend, icon }) {
  return (
    <Card variant="outlined" padding="small">
      <div style={{ display: 'flex', justifyContent: 'space-between', alignItems: 'center' }}>
        <div>
          <p style={{ fontSize: '14px', color: '#666' }}>{title}</p>
          <p style={{ fontSize: '32px', fontWeight: 'bold', margin: '8px 0' }}>
            {value}
          </p>
          <p style={{ fontSize: '12px', color: trend >= 0 ? 'green' : 'red' }}>
            {trend >= 0 ? '↑' : '↓'} {Math.abs(trend)}% from last month
          </p>
        </div>
        <div style={{ fontSize: '48px', opacity: 0.2 }}>
          {icon}
        </div>
      </div>
    </Card>
  );
}
```

### Clickable Card (Navigation)

```tsx title="src/components/NavigationCard.tsx"
import { Card } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';
import { useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom';

function NavigationCard({ title, description, path, icon }) {
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  return (
    <Card
      title={title}
      subtitle={description}
      variant="elevated"
      hoverable
      onClick={() => navigate(path)}
    >
      <div style={{ fontSize: '48px', textAlign: 'center', padding: '32px 0' }}>
        {icon}
      </div>
    </Card>
  );
}

// Better approach - with explicit link
function AccessibleNavigationCard({ title, description, path, icon }) {
  return (
    <Card
      title={title}
      subtitle={description}
      variant="elevated"
      hoverable
    >
      <div style={{ fontSize: '48px', textAlign: 'center', padding: '32px 0' }}>
        {icon}
      </div>
      <a href={path} style={{ display: 'block', textAlign: 'center' }}>
        View Details →
      </a>
    </Card>
  );
}
```

### Card with Image

```tsx title="src/components/ImageCard.tsx"
import { Card } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function ImageCard({ image, title, description, tags }) {
  return (
    <Card padding="none" variant="outlined">
      <img
        src={image}
        alt={title}
        style={{
          width: '100%',
          height: '240px',
          objectFit: 'cover',
        }}
      />
      <div style={{ padding: '16px' }}>
        <h3 style={{ margin: '0 0 8px 0' }}>{title}</h3>
        <p style={{ margin: '0 0 16px 0', color: '#666' }}>
          {description}
        </p>
        <div style={{ display: 'flex', gap: '8px', flexWrap: 'wrap' }}>
          {tags.map((tag) => (
            <span
              key={tag}
              style={{
                padding: '4px 12px',
                background: '#f0f0f0',
                borderRadius: '16px',
                fontSize: '12px',
              }}
            >
              {tag}
            </span>
          ))}
        </div>
      </div>
    </Card>
  );
}
```

## Related Components

- **Container** - For simple layout containers without card styling
- **Stack** - For arranging multiple cards or organizing card content
- **Paper** - For elevated surfaces without card-specific features (if available)
- **Panel** - For collapsible card-like sections (if available)

## TypeScript Support

The Card component is fully typed with TypeScript:

```tsx
import type { ReactNode } from 'react';

export type CardProps = {
  /** Card content */
  children: ReactNode;
  /** Card title */
  title?: string;
  /** Card subtitle or description */
  subtitle?: string;
  /** Footer content */
  footer?: ReactNode;
  /** Visual variant */
  variant?: 'default' | 'elevated' | 'outlined' | 'filled';
  /** Padding size */
  padding?: 'none' | 'small' | 'medium' | 'large';
  /** Make card interactive/hoverable */
  hoverable?: boolean;
  /** Click handler */
  onClick?: () => void;
  /** Additional CSS classes */
  className?: string;
};
```

This ensures type safety and autocomplete in your IDE for all card props and variants.
